channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report E-2024020605
item.description:
Report E-2024020605

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: MUNDS PARK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TITAN TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0825 ET Titan Transfer Inc. contacted ERTS to request assistance with cleaning a 8 gallon release of UN1210-INK- PMC031 DK GRN SDA3C. It was reported the release was coming from a vehicle impacting concrete located on I-17 Munds Park AZ USA at the Christensen Rest Area (Southbound; Mile Marker #32). At 1248 EST, Graymar arrived on site and located the release. At 1320 EST, Graymar confirmed an estimated 8 gallons of PMC031D5 Dark Green SDA3C released. No drains or waterways were impacted. Newell Technologies, confirmed the product is flammable as a liquid, but once solidified, it is non-hazardous. GrayMar used absorbents, worked it into the impact, collected and placed into one 55-gal poly drum. The contractor will transport the one drum of spent absorbents to the contractor's shop. The impacted 15 gallon pail of product was placed into an overpack and placed onto the trailer as salvage material.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A CALL AT THE IRREG BELT. UPON ARRIVAL THE RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS MOVED FROM ITS ORIGINAL PLACE. RESPONDER THEN PROCEEDED TO FOLLOW PROCEDURE AND PROPERLY TRANSPORTED THE LEAKER FROM THE IRREG BELT BACK TO THE PSC.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to qa are in a hazmat tote with lining. It was contained and processed. DescribePack: The packaging is damaged with holes from being wet. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazmat tote with lining and staged in a safe area.

item.title: Report X-2024021138
item.description:
Report X-2024021138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX DISCOVERED ON DOCK BY MANAGER AND PLACED INTO HAZMAT BAG- COLLECTED BY QA FOR PROCESSING DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX IS STAINED FROM THE FLUID CONTAINED INSIDE THE PLASTIC BOTTLES WHICH HERE ALSO PLACED INSIDE DURABLE PLASTIC BAG AND SEALED SHUT.THE BOTTLES HAVE NO CRACKS OR LEAKS OR DENTS BUT THE FLUID HAS STAINED THE LABEL AND DAMAGED THE OUTER PACKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY THE BAG WAS IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO A HAZMAT BAG, AND ALL SURROUNDING SURFACES WERE WIPED DOWN

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package had come out of the trailer damaged and the bag out of the plastic pail. The damaged hazmat came to QA to be processed, also this package was improperly labeled in the sense of the label itself. The label shows as a normal package when this is a hazmat DescribePack: Their is a puncture the size of approx. 1.5 feet allowing the bag of DurationRel: 45 and MitigateEffect: minimalize shaking of the pail

item.title: Report X-2024021188

Report X-2024021188

  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the unload process wet and was placed into lined tote and QA was notified. DescribePack: Loose cap caused the inner container to leak and damage the outer packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined hazmat tote with orientation arrows up to avoid any further leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024021128
item.description:
Report X-2024021128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While on the rollers waiting to be loaded hazmat toppled over when another box was placed next to it. The insufficient inner packing caused the lid to easily become loose. DescribePack: Box became wet inside and out along with a big tear coming down the side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was then immediately picked up by trained QA and placed in a yellow drum lined with hazmat bags to prevent further leakage while properly processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021140
item.description:
Report X-2024021140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found while preload was unloading a trailer (450898). It already had a strong smell of the spilled contents and package was wet and stained. DescribePack: The contents of the container spilled out, almost all the contents. Upon inspection, when the material was lifted that was on the bottle, it was noticed that a cap wasn't there. Unsure how that may have happened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage for processing.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HazMat was discovered with a puncture on the body of inner container. Package was placed a lined HazMat tote. Surfaces that were leak on were cleaned in house. DescribePack: The puncture is on the bottom right corner of the container. Size of the puncture no greater than a dime. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: HazMat was removed from the floor and placed in HazMat cage. Surfaces affected were cleaned up in house.
